p.s: I received your e-mail and the questions you have, regarding coffee to go in Germany.
I want to help you with your project so of course I am going to answer all of them.
The answer to your first question is yes, coffee cups are also very popular here in Germany.
In fact it is a symbol for being wealthy and busy with work.
People carry their cups with them like an accessory.
Even if coffee to go is very comfortable it is also very problematic, considering that over 7 million cups a day end up in the trash.
This is not enviromentalenvironmental friendly at all because all of the ressourcesresources that are being used for a coffee cup are going to waste, after only 15 minutes of using it.
Furthermore these cups cannot be recycled because the cups are made out of a mix of plastic and paper, so you cannot even throw them away in the right bin.
I have been thinking about good alternatives and I want to give you some examples.
You can either buy a sustainable cup, even though it is not the best solution because of the sizes that are available on the market.
The only solution that makes sense is to not drink coffee while being in a rush.
You should sit down and take a few minutes out of you schedule to drink coffee.
If you don't have time for coffee, you should take it as a sign to slow down.
I hope I could help you and if you have more questions just write me another e-mail.
I hope your presentation is going to be flawless!
